H0.text: Sediment is nearly absent from the rocks at the mid‑ocean ridge.

H1.text: Minerals are nearly free of the rocks at the mid‑ocean ridge.

H2.text: Scratches are nearly absent from the rocks at the mid‑ocean ridge.

H3.text: Metals are nearly absent from the rocks at the mid-ocean ridge.

A4.text: New magma steadily emerges onto the ocean floor and intrudes into the existing ocean crust at and near rifts along the ridge axes.

A5.text: The crust and the relatively rigid peridotite below it make up the oceanic lithosphere, which sits above the less rigid and viscous asthenosphere.
